LocationDescription: on the cut across from Warner Hall
Title: Walking to the Sky
Notes: A gift of Jill Gansman Kraus and Peter Kraus
Information: This 100 foot tall, seven ton sculpture reflects Carnegie Mellonâ€™s 21st century effort to bring new forms of art and architecture to campus. It is inspired by story of friendly giant who lived in the sky and is a celebration of the human potential for discovering who we are and where we need to go. Walking to the Sky symbolizes ambitions of students and faculty, reaching out for new knowledge.
